Events.OnCreate:
(block (enemyStations) (switch ; Get a list of enemy stations in the region. If we cannot find any ; suitable targets then we don't have a mission. (not (setq enemyStations (sysFindObject aOwnerObj "TAE +populated; -outlawMiners; -penitents; -questTarget; -uncharted;"))) ;L:4-5 (msnDestroy gSource)
; Create the mission
(block ( ; Pick a random enemy station to destroy
(targetObj (seededRandom (objGetDestiny aOwnerObj) enemyStations))
; The reward for the station is half of the standard ; treasure value for the station.
(rewardExact (/ (obj@ targetObj 'stdTreasure) 2))
; Round it to the nearest 100
(reward (max 100 (* 100 (round (/ rewardExact 100))))) )
; Remember it (msnSetData gSource 'targetID (objGetID targetObj)) (msnSet@ gSource 'reward reward)
; Register for events so we know when the target is destroyed (msnRegisterForEvents gSource targetObj) ) ) )

Language.Text:
Your mission is to destroy %targetName% in %systemName%.
System: %systemName%\n Payment: %payment%

You are in the command center surrounded by wall maps and scanner displays. The commanding officer of the fortress looks up from his charts:
"Are you looking for a mission, pilot?"
Language.String: "Why don't you make yourself useful and get us some tea or something."
"What is your major malfunction!? Get back out there and complete your mission!"
"You screwed that mission all the way to Sol and back. You better hit the sims, pilot!"
Language.Text:
"%TargetName% in the system has been harassing traffic in the area. We want you to take it out.
"We'll pay %payment% if you succeed. Clear?"
"Well done! You dealt with that threat expertly. We've deposited %payment% in your account."
